text: Charles Keith Lehr, Jr., known as Keith Lehr (born November 1963) is an American poker player from his native Bossier City, Louisiana, who is a two- time World Series of Poker bracelet winner. ==Poker career== Lehr won his first bracelet at the 2003 World Series of Poker in the $3,000 Pot Limit Hold'em event. His second bracelet came in the 2015 World Series of Poker Heads-up No Limit event earning $334,430.WSOP: Keith Lehr Wins 2015 Heads- up.Keith Lehr wins second bracelet Lehr (using the nickname "cheesemonster") won the Full Tilt Online Poker Series Main Event in May 2008, winning $410,780.2008 Year in Review in Bluff in March 2009Keith Lehr at cardplayer.com Lehr largest cashed was for $701,757 at the 2012 World Series of Poker $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em (Six Handed) event.PokerNews WSOP 2012 report As of 2015, his earnings exceeded $2,100,000.RankingHero database ==References== Category:1963 births Category:Living people Category:American poker players Category:World Series of Poker bracelet winners Category:People from Bossier City, Louisiana Category:Louisiana Republicans
title: Keith Lehr
